newsitem.title: USA: EnviroSource sells unit to IMCO.
newsitem.headline: EnviroSource sells unit to IMCO.

text.p: EnviroSource Inc said on Wednesday that it has signed a definitive agreement to sell its IMSAMET subsidiary to IMCO Recycling Inc for $58 million.
IMSAMET, which has operations in Arizona, Idaho and Utah, serves the aluminum industry by recycling dross, scrap and used beverage cans.
Envirosource said it is taking this step in order to focus efforts on its steel-related businesses, International Mill Service and EnviroSource Treatment & Disposal Services.
The company said that the proceeds from the sale would be used to reduce bank borrowings.
It said it expects the sale to be completed in late December or early January.
